There is nothing I can do for it.At least give me a useful suggestion.please.
OK, I'll add some test cases.
It looks like parse problem, does anybody interesting this issue?
@terrymanu Please assign the SQL parse bug to me. I will be responsible for this module bugs.
Thank you, assigned

Do you want data migration?
If You want to change sharding rule, it should use data migration.
I think it can be solved by `create table if not exists`. Would you mind have a try?

> Maybe we do not need talk about business logic here, we just make sure if we permit `null` for sharding value, which data node should the data inserted into?

other sharding column(tenant_id,customer_id) can known data node.

After testing more cases, I don't think it is related to the select * or select fields, it is because of that there is a null value for a field, it will set to null values for all other values. I think this should be a bug ?
**For English only**, other languages will not accept.
Hi ,for un sharding fields, once a value of not the sharding fields with null , all the records after that will be set to null

I have a tested with Sharding-Proxy-4.0.0-RC2 with my sharding algorithm jar, it works as expected, only the timestamp bug I raised few days ago. from RC2 to RC4, there were a big code changes or redesign in the sharding-proxy?

> Hi ,for un sharding fields, once a value of not the sharding fields with null , all the records after that will be set to null

thank you for your reply, i will change my colum Field  cannot be null.

> I think it can be solved by `create table if not exists`. Would you mind have a try?

I'm using spring-data-jpa, and it's  configuration is ddl-auto:update. that is ` create table if not exists `.
maybe the problem is jpa ?

> Do you want data migration?
> If You want to change sharding rule, it should use data migration.

I want to expand the table. our order's  sharding rule is one table one month.
and now it will 2020 soon
You sharding rule is base on month, Historical data will not be affected. @KomachiSion advice will work for you.
I get the point, it means part of sharding key in multiple sharding strategy can be null, is it?

> I get the point, it means part of sharding key in multiple sharding strategy can be null, is it?

yes
I will review this fix as soon as possible, Thanks @RaigorJiang .
I will try to solve it.
Ok, can you change the title? I can set label to volunteer wanted for this issue

bravo ！ @KomachiSion :laughing:

I wonder how does shardingsphere writting data when migrating . 

Job...ennnn....so that's why there is a union meet up with dopoinescheduler at this Sunday.
Thanks @taojintianxia , I hope we can have a happy and significant meet up with dolphinscheduler.
Thank you, assigned

Because parse SQL by ANTLR is slow, and ShardingSphere save the 1st parse result into cache.
Please see details here: https://shardingsphere.apache.org/document/current/en/features/sharding/principle/parse/

I don't think we can enhance the performance before the AST into cache. If you want, you can consider about  preheat your SQL.
duplicated with #3644
how to get the source code of the version 4.0.0-RC2? I want to try to finx the timestamp bug base on it

I have readed the document before and knew ANTLR is slow. Our project has hundreds SQL, and many SQL like 'select...in (...)' or 'insert...values(...)'，and the number of parameters is different, so it has thousands different situations. It is impractical to preheat so many SQL (preheat every SQL need serval seconds). So any other way to handle with it? 

I think if the SQL contain the table which need sharding or encrypt some column, it can parse SQL by ANTLR, but for other table,  maybe it is not need parse by ANTLR but with druid, or others. Or is there any more elegant way complete it?

Hi @CatDogZ ,

**For English only**, other languages will not accept.
You can close this issue and submit a new issue in English again.

https://shardingsphere.apache.org/benchmark

This is ShardingSphere' benchmark website, you can pay attention to it.
**For English only**, other languages will not accept.

It is unconvincing if our community compare shardingSphere and other projects.
Please do it by yourself if you want
What is your actual version? Actually, ShardingSphere do not have version 4.0

> What is your actual version? Actually, ShardingSphere do not have version 4.0

Hi，the version is 4.0.0-RC2

##### 💛  - [Coveralls](https://coveralls.io)

When I looked at some code of sharding - core and sharding - spring, I found that ShardingDataSourceBeanDefinitionParser will register a SpringShardingDataSource bean to spring.Then according to the configuration in ShardingRuleConfiguration - > TableRuleConfiguration - > KeyGeneratorConfiguration, the constructor of SpringShardingDataSource creates the corresponding ShardingKeyGenerator instance by way of SPI.
When SPI is used to create an instance of a ShardingKeyGenerator, it will make all lot of peices instances of ShardingKeyGenerator of all types, and we can iterate to find type that we want. Now We can optimize this issue if we make the ShardingKeyGenerator as a spring bean, and at the time we need to considerate the decoupling of sharding-core and sharding-spring.
This is the context of this issue as I understand, am I right?
@TaoZhiMLND Sure, you are totally correct. We can discuss how to decouple it if you want.
@tristaZero @terrymanu  I try to fix this bug. Please assign to me.

> I'm using spring-data-jpa, and it's configuration is ddl-auto:update. that is `create table if not exists`.

Can you open show.sql both of jpa and shardingsphere to restart your project, it can see the create table SQL generated by jpa and the actual routed SQL by shardingsphere.

> > I think if the SQL contain the table which need sharding or encrypt some column, it can parse SQL by ANTLR, but for other table, maybe it is not need parse by ANTLR but with druid, or others. Or is there any more elegant way complete it?
> 
> No one can afford taking control two different SQL parser engines. If you interesting develop a new SQL parser engine, maybe we can talk about pull request.

It sounds that there is not better solution for this issue. I don't know is there any other effect if i change the source code like this:  the logic sql is not contain the table which need sharding or encrypt some column, i create prepared statement by logic sql.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33616750/70400689-1dac3480-1a67-11ea-8ce0-f05e2cd9e1fc.png)

If sharding-proxy can not support HA well by itself right now,is there any compromising solution to avoid single-point riskment in production environment? How do you use sharding-proxy in JD?
@terrymanu
You can just run `org.apache.shardingsphere.shardingproxy.Bootstrap` to startup the proxy in your IDEA.
I think you can use Nginx, HAProxy, LVS to handle load balance within TCP layer. use `keepalived` or `heartbeat` to support HA

> I think you can use Nginx, HAProxy, LVS to handle load balance within TCP layer. use `keepalived` or `heartbeat` to support HA

do you mean I can set  Nginx or other middleware between application and sharding-proxy cluster to support HA ? @cherrylzhao
not yet, I have provided a way to build sharding-proxy cluster since sharding-proxy is stateless if you have not begin XA transaction

it seems that we should instance KeyGenerator when constructing `KeyGeneratorConfiguration` instead of inside `TableRule`. for spring-namespace we can leverage `FactoryBean` to create KeyGenerator through our NewInstanceServiceLoader.

> not yet, I have provided a way to build sharding-proxy cluster since sharding-proxy is stateless if you have not begin XA transaction

So I should build sharding-proxy cluster by myself to implement sharding-proxy's HA feature.
Is there any document to help me  build sharding-proxy cluster?
not yet now, you can goole it then contributing a PR for it :)

@KomachiSion Should we consider cache preheating?
I think there are no necessary for cache preheating. Because only when users change the shardingRule or datasource, the scaling out create and start. it's hard for us to predict users' new rule.

> if null == shardingRule is false, it will take the first logicTableName.

> it's mean if i change the shardingRule, it will not work for the new rule.

if you change the logicTableName in shardingRule, or you change the actualNodes to other name, it may cause the `getTable` return the old actualTable name.

But in your configuration, your logicTable do not change, and the actualNode only add some node. so the `getTable` will return the same result-- your logicTableName

what is your db & table character config？

you can try insert data directly, not via Sharding-Proxy, It is OK?
